findings.title: Deployer can mint after initial deployment
findings.description: The deployer has the ability to mint tokens even after the initial deployment.

findings.title: Unencrypted Private Data On-Chain
findings.description: Access to Critical Private Variable via Public Method

findings.title: Message call with hardcoded gas amount
Hash Collisions with Multiple Variable Length Arguments
findings.description: This finding indicates a vulnerability where hash collisions can occur due to multiple variable length arguments, potentially leading to authentication bypass by capture-replay.

findings.title: Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables found in the contract which can lead to irrelevant code.

findings.title: Right-To Left Override control character (U+202E)
findings.description: The Right-To-Left Override control character (U+202E) can be used to manipulate the visual representation of text, potentially leading to phishing or other attacks.

findings.title: DoS With Block Gas Limit
findings.description: The contract may be vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) attacks due to uncontrolled resource consumption related to block gas limit.

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
findings.description: The finding indicates a potential vulnerability where an arbitrary jump can occur with a function type variable.

findings.title: Insufficient Gas Griefing
findings.description: Insufficient control flow management can lead to gas griefing attacks.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: Improper Following of Specification by Caller

findings.title: Lack of Proper Signature Verification
findings.description: Improper verification of cryptographic signature leading to potential signature replay attacks.
